newsitem.title: USA: Intl Dairy Queen sells Firstaff stake.
newsitem.headline: Intl Dairy Queen sells Firstaff stake.

text.p: International Dairy Queen Inc said Tuesday that it sold its majority position in Firstaff Inc to AccuStaff Inc for undisclosed terms.
It also said AccuStaff bought the minority position of Jim Ginther Sr in Firstaff.

International Dairy Queen acquired its Firstaff interest in 1989. Firstaff provides permanent and temporary office staffing and computer application training services in the Minneapolis-St. Paul area and staffing services through a franchised operations in Seattle.
AccuStaff, based in Jacksonville, Fla., has revenues of about $1.5 billion.

Mike Sullivan, president of International Dairy Queen, said in a statement, "Although the Firstaff operations have been a profitable fit over the years, with the accelerated consolidation and competitiveness of the staffing business worldwide, IDQ and Ginther reevaluated Firstaff's fit as part of long-term IDQ strategy."
